item.title:
RT by @letsgetonchain: Seeing a lot of confusion between account abstraction and chain abstraction. Both are a subset of a broader push to improve blockchain UX.
I define chain abstraction as an effort to make interactions independent of the underlying network from a UX perspective while preserving properties such as trustlessness and permissionlessness.
Nice to see those different demos visually!

Bad news: under the hood, he has 300 USDC on @ethereum, 300 USDC on @arbitrum and 400 USDC on @zksync.
Good news: He doesn't even know any of it.

item.title:
R to @letsgetonchain: 6/ Finalized commitments by default.
If user funds are pre-locked in a smart wallet, the solver can safely execute on the destination chain immediately, no finality wait needed, because it can later claim those locked funds as repayment.
Cross chain latency solved!
